text: Arthur Pomeroy, D.D. was an 18th-century Anglican priest in Ireland."A New History of Ireland" T. W. Moody, F. X. Martin, F.J. Byrne and Cosgrove, A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 Pomeroy was born in Devon and educated at Westminster School and Trinity College, Cambridge.Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900, John Venn/John Archibald Venn Cambridge University Press > (10 volumes 1922 to 1953) Part I. 1209-1751 ol. iii. Kaile – Ryves, (1924) p377 He was Chaplain to Arthur Capell, 1st Earl of Essex, Lord Lieutenant of Ireland from 1672 to 1677.Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (Third Edition, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. pp. 360–361 Essex appointed him Dean of CorkSouth Dublin Libraries on 11 February 1673. He was instituted on 5 May that year and served until his death in 1710."Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p241 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 He was also Treasurer of Cloyne"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p316 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 Prebendary of Kilpeacon in Limerick Cathedral"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p416 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 and Rector of Carrigaline."Clerical and Parochial Records of Cork, Cloyne and Ross" Brady, William Maziere p124: London; Longmans; 1864 ==References== Category:Deans of Kilfenora Category:Archdeacons of Kilfenora Category:17th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge Category:Clergy from Devon Category:1710 deaths Category:People educated at Westminster School, London
title: Arthur Pomeroy
